meanings.definition: Small insects that infest books and feed on mold and fungi.
meanings.sent1: Booklice can damage old books by feeding on mold inside them.
meanings.sent2: Librarians need to watch out for booklice infestations in the archives.
meanings.sent3: The booklice had a feast on the ancient manuscripts, turning them into their own buffet.
meanings.sent4: The booklice multiplied rapidly, spreading through the library like a tiny army.
meanings.sent5: The sight of booklice crawling out of the old books was enough to make anyone shudder.

meanings.sent1: I found a booklice on the page of my favorite novel.
meanings.sent2: The booklice scurried across the desk, looking for a new hiding spot.
meanings.sent3: The booklice seemed to be on a solo mission to explore the bookshelf.
meanings.sent4: The tiny booklice stood out among the pages, like a lone traveler in a vast library.
meanings.sent5: Spotting the booklice on the book felt like discovering a tiny secret inhabitant.
